CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 9, 1953, pg. 12, reads: "Hill City Coronation - This group of charming young girls is shown during last Friday's Hill City coronation ceremonies in which Miss Romaine Parham, seated in center, was crowned queen. Surrounding her are her ladies in waiting and princesses of the court.  Ladies in waiting were Shirley Smith, Darlene Casey, Frances Peterson and Mary Strother.  Princesses of the court included Christine Bundridge, Lorraine Pearson, Ruby Thomas, Shirley Mason, Betty Tate, Sarah Plowden, Marilyn Bryant, Geraldine Stevens, Lillie Tolbert, Queenie Stachell and Lorraine Spears. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Two young men wearing uniforms and holding rifles, in front of Romaine Parham receiving crown, on stage with girl in ballet costume on right, and Shirley Smith, Darlene Casey, Frances Peterson, Mary Strother, Christine Bundridge, Lorraine Pearson, Ruby Thomas, Shirley Mason, Betty Tate, Sarah Plowden, Marilyn Bryant, Geraldine Stevens, Lillie Tolbert, Queenie Stachell, and Lorraine Spears, in Hill City
